newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAB SHARE OFFER INCREASED TO $413 MILLION.
newsitem.headline: SAB SHARE OFFER INCREASED TO $413 MILLION.

text.p: South African Breweries Ltd said on Wednesday that it had increased its international share offering to $413 million (1.9 billion rand), following strong international demand.
SAB said the manager's option for a further two million share was being exercised by Robert Fleming and Co Ltd on behalf of the managers.
The additional issue will take place on the same terms as the earlier issue of 16.25 million new shares.

The issue takes the form of ordinary shares of 20 South African cents each and American Depositary Shares (each representing the right to receive an ordinary share) at a price of $25.43 (115 rand) per share.
Proceeds of the issue, one of the largest private sector emerging market equity issues to date, will be used to fund the company's continuing international expansion.
